result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Shawn Hellerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin Shawn Hellerman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin Shawn Hellerman was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-If revoked to run consecutive to 14CF385.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF385

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to reside with parents until Minnesota Agent is able to make acceptable alternative recommendation.
-Follow through with treatment and programming as recommended by Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared. Includes: 14CF385 and 15CF89. Cases called at 1:36 pm. Court notes PSI was completed. ADA Minser gives sentencing argument. Atty. Repka responds. DEF makes statement. Court outlines factors used in sentencing. Court Orders:

14CF385 Ct 2:  I/S, Total 3 years 6 months, I/C: 1 year 6 mos, E/S: 2 years 0 months
3 years probation to run concurrent; if DEF is to revoked to run consecutive to 15CF89, with conditions:
-$268 court costs

14CF385 Ct 3: 70 days St. Croix County Jail, credit for 52 days served, credit for good time, time served
-$268 court costs

15CF89 Ct 1: I/S, Total 6 years,  I/C: 3 years 0 months, E/S: 3 years 0 months
3 years probation to run concurrent; if DEF is to revoked to run consecutive to 14CF385, with conditions:
-$268 court costs
DNA surcharge - $250

Conditions:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Sign up for probation today, may be transferred to MN Agent
-DEF is to reside with parents until MN Agent is able to make acceptable alternative recommendation
-Follow through with treatment and programming as recommended by agent

Apply bond on file to fees
Court advises DEF of right to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka, DF: Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared.  Court called at 3:09 p.m.  Includes case 14CF385, 14CF536, 15CF31 & 15CF89.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form for File 14CF385 & 15CF89.  Crt reviews plea questionnaires and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 14CF385 & Ct. 1 in 15CF89 .  Court reviews search warrants and police reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 14CF385 & Ct. 1 in 15CF89.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & Ct. 4 in 14CF385 & Ct 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4 & Ct. 5 in 15CF89 & Crt dismisses 14CF536 & 15CF31.  DE to receive a COMPAS Evaluation and long form PSI before court will schedule the SEH.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:31 p.m. lw
Filed by Def's parents. Re: case. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared.  Court called at 1:43 p.m.  Set for FPT.  Includes case 14CF385, 14CF536, 15CF31 & 15CF89.  Attorney Repka advises the court there is a resolution.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bond is modified to add Jessica Dickerson to list of people who can supervise the DE.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L. Hahn, DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka, DF: Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared.  Court called at 11:09 a.m.  Includes case 14CF385, 14CF536, 15CF31 & 15CF89.  ADA Hahn advises there has been an offer by the State but no agreement at this time.  Branch 1 at this time only has file 15CF89.  Attorney Repka is asking to have the other three files transfered to Branch 1.  Attorney Repka has filed a Motion to Modify who can supervise him and who can be present when he enters his residence.  Court grants the Motion.  Bail is continued as modified.  Court adjourned at 11:19 a.m. lw  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's to Modify the conditions of release filed by Atty Repka. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka, DF: Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared.  Court called.  Attorney Repka advises the court that at this time there is no resolution.  Continue PTC.  Attorney Repka makes statement regarding DE progress. Court adjourned at 11:0 a.m.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork, DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared.  Court called at 3:35 p.m.  Attorney Repka advises the court they are working towards a resolution.  Court grants the DE permission with a police escort to retrieve items from the 1830 Dutch Heritage Court property in Baldwin Wisconsin.  Continue PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:40 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Alvin Hellerman  15R 004790. eif

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin Shawn Hellerman
Current: 52970 Cty Hwy 6, Parkers Prairie, MN 56361 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2015)
Prior: 1830 Dutch Heritage Ct, Baldwin, WI 54002 
per Defendant's bond. lw
Pre-trial conference on April 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

*AMENDED*

-  DE is not to return to 1830 Dutch Heritage Court, Baldwin Wisconsin.    

- DE will reside with  parents, Alvin and Carol Hellerman and he has to be with either Alvin and Carol Hellerman or sisters Jessica Dickerson, Kristine Dickerson if DE leaves the residence on a day trip.  The  DE can be released to an inpatient facility but if it is outpatient the DE must be transported by the above named persons.   

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Danielle Q.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L. Hahn, DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka, DF: Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:06 p.m.  Set for arraignment.  DE reviews the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not Guilty Plea is entered.  Attorney Repka is asking for a bond modification.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by ADA McKinley. km
Arraignment on March 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Shawn Hellerman appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:24 a.m.  Set out for Preliminary Hearing.   S/T of Investigator Ducklow Pierce County Sheriff's Office.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by Investigator Ducklow.  Cross by Attorney Repka.   Witness is excused.  State asks the court to take notice of the bonds in files 15CF31, 14CF385 & 14CF536.  Court takes Judical Notice.  Attorneys make arguments.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed it and the court binds the DE over for trial.  Motion by Attorney Repka for a bail modification.  ADA Mckinley objects.  Attorney Repka makes arguement.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:48 a.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.
